channel.title: Personal Kanban on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Personal Kanban on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Using Github Issues and Waffle.io as a personal kanban board
item.description: I’ve been using Github issues to track my personal todo list for quite some time now, and since November I’ve been using Waffle.io to help that process. Waffle in this use is a view of a series of queues in my todo list. Most everything that I’m not doing now lives in the “backlog” queue, which I try to keep to less than 100 just to keep myself sane. (At more than 100 there’s usually a lot of duplicates; at less than 100 I’m probably not acknowledging that there’s something to be done).

item.title: Personal Kanban from Jim Benson and Modus Cooperandi
item.description: I’m reading PersonalKanban.com.  There are at the simplest only two rules: 1. Visualize your work 2. Limit your work-in-progress to which is added a third, “prioritize”. The rest is commentary. Jim is good at commentary, so the blog and the rest of the effort is well worth reading. Here’s Personal Kanban 101 to start. Personal Kanban 101 from Jim Benson
